title: Brazilian federal police crack down on terrorist groups linked to Hezbollah
description:
The Brazilian Federal Police on Wednesday launched an operation to dismantle organizations that were “preparing” to carry out terrorist acts in Brazil, as well as “recruiting Brazilians to carry out extreme acts in the country.” According to several reports, they were planning to attack buildings in Jewish communities in Brazil. Marshals executed two temporary arrest […]

The post Brazilian federal police crack down on terrorist groups linked to Hezbollah appeared first on The Brazilian Report.

title: https://brazilian.report/podcast/2023/11/08/sao-paulo-enel-power-outage/
description:
São Paulo faced a massive power outage in recent days. The episode rekindled debates about the privatization of public services

The post appeared first on The Brazilian Report.

title: Grocery sales push Brazilian retail growth in September
description:
A certain relief in debt levels and the continuous drop in food prices allowed Brazilian families to spend more in supermarkets and grocery stores in September. This was the main reason behind the 0.6 percent growth in retail sales over the previous month (a 3.3 percent year-on-year) growth. Retail growth amounts to 1.8 percent in […]

The post Grocery sales push Brazilian retail growth in September appeared first on The Brazilian Report.
